text: Hello everyone, is it possible to query the version history of a deal property via API? Or is the display only possible via the UI?

Hi :slightly_smiling_face: I've added custom classes for styling of 'no-link' CTAs. The problem is if they are placed next to each other (in this case on the front-page hero) they overlap with each other instead of wrapping in tablet view, before actually wrapping on mobile. Is there anything I can do to fix this so the CTAs don't overlap? I would rather not have to change the media queries for the whole theme.

Yes, it is possible to query the version history of a deal property via API. The HubSpot Deals API allows you to retrieve the history of changes made to a deal property, including the previous value, new value, timestamp, and the user who made the change.

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
But I don't think they're are just talking about DNS, I think they are talking more about hosting, image optimization, etc. Also you can't prevent HubSpot from using cloudflare's DNS

Hi everyone, I am working on a integration that requires to connect HubSpot Call activities to the contacts. and I am using "*GET /crm/v3/objects/calls*" V3 Calls endpoint to get all calls, I am not sure how to connect this calls with contact information I noticed "*Associations*" Parameter in the request but I am not sure what to enter in that parameter since we are using automatic associations from Contact-to-call.  link to the doc :(<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/calls#tab-2>)
Are you creating these calls through the api?
FYI that association parameter is just for see what associations (for a particular type) already exist
I am using python HubSpot Code sample from the Documentation

sorry I misunderstood, I am not creating calls I am retrieving calls that already made, when I was doing get request I am able to pull phone numbers and other properties but not "contact associated with the call (like contact id)". If I do have any relevant contact information that I can pull using the get request (i,e contact id, email id) I can join with contacts right now I do have phone number but the phone number is not an unique field
Hello! Iâ€™m experiencing the same issues. How did you fix this?

Flexible redirect does not seem to be working, can anyone tell me why:

Original URL: <http://www.mydomain.com/blog2/*rest-of-url>
Redirecting To: <http://www.mydomain.com/emea/insights/blog/{rest-of-url}>
Priority: 1
Redirect Style: Permanent (301)

I checked other redirects in the system and none have a priority less than 1, but also none are using flexible redirect syntax, and there is a redirect but going to nowhere that is being set in HubSpot

There is another flexible redirect but it is priority 2, that indicates:
Original URL: <http://www.mydomain.com/blog/*rest-of-url>
Redirecting To: <http://www.mydomain.com/us/insights/blog/{rest-of-url}>
Priority: 2
Redirect Style: Permanent (301)

It seems this one is prioritizing over the 1, and /blog2 flexible redirect is not working just /blog
Hi all, I want to test the webhook functionality of HubSpot.. I already created an App with all the settings... how do I connect this app to my main HubSpot account?
